channel.title: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:14, topic:537362”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=656180.msg4392620#msg4392620 date=1388079354]

i don’t see many differences besides that it looks like you used eclipse to format it

Well i didn’t extend the JFrame… he told me to do that.

You only extend it if you’re going to use a lot of the classes functions.

You should always use inheritance when possible.

That is terrible advice. Did you read the link I provided for him that discourages extending JFrame? Do NOT abuse inheritance in any OOP language. Use it when you are EXTENDING the functionality of a class, not when you are using a lot of a class. Aggregation is just as useful as inheritance, one is not better than another except for per-situation (such as extending functionality, in which case inheritance is far better).
[/quote]
I don’t see the problem as long as you are extending the class and can preserve the ‘is-a’ aspects of inheritance.[/quote]
I think we all stated our point on my code. I’m researching on it… Now stop replying and grow up this isn’t the form to fight like 2 year olds over programming.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:13, topic:537362”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=656180.msg4392136#msg4392136 date=1387902722]

i don’t see many differences besides that it looks like you used eclipse to format it

Well i didn’t extend the JFrame… he told me to do that.

You only extend it if you’re going to use a lot of the classes functions.

You should always use inheritance when possible.
[/quote]

That is terrible advice. Did you read the link I provided for him that discourages extending JFrame? Do NOT abuse inheritance in any OOP language. Use it when you are EXTENDING the functionality of a class, not when you are using a lot of a class. Aggregation is just as useful as inheritance, one is not better than another except for per-situation (such as extending functionality, in which case inheritance is far better).[/quote]
I don’t see the problem as long as you are extending the class and can preserve the ‘is-a’ aspects of inheritance.

Read full topic

[/quote]
You only extend it if you’re going to use a lot of the classes functions.

You should always use inheritance when possible.[/quote]

That is terrible advice. Did you read the link I provided for him that discourages extending JFrame? Do NOT abuse inheritance in any OOP language. Use it when you are EXTENDING the functionality of a class, not when you are using a lot of a class. Aggregation is just as useful as inheritance, one is not better than another except for per-situation (such as extending functionality, in which case inheritance is far better).

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:4, topic:537362”][ul][li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10442665/extending-a-jframe (why extending a JFrame is not a good idea generally)[/li]
[li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14694987/why-declare-variables-private-in-a-class (lack of access modifiers)[/li]
[li]http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/codeconv-138413.html (you have a lot of arbitrary newlines and you don’t make use of whitespace consistently)[/li]
[li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/94361/when-do-you-use-javas-override-annotation-and-why (this is more for Java 6 when it comes to overloading interface methods, but it’s still good practice)[/li]
[li]http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/201175/should-i-use-parentheses-in-logical-statements-even-where-not-necessary (your if statements sometimes use a lot of operators and the operator precedence may not be clear to other prorammers)[/li]
[li]You have a ton of statements like ‘quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)’ consecutively. Why execute this dozens of times (worst case) when you could just save it to a local variable and check that? You might think the compilers will optimize this, but it’s never guaranteed (and probably unlikely in Java).[/li]
[li]I would recommend you to use more single line comments here and there to explain what is going on.[/li]
[li]It’s not exactly a ‘best practice,’ but I personally don’t like seeing member variables initialized outside of constructors, since it makes it less clear to a programmer coming into your code what is going on (typically you go to the constructor to see what’s being built).[/li][/ul]

Just a few points I’ve noticed. There are likely other things, but these are good places to start (especially with your formatting).[/quote]
Thank you so much! I’m reviewing these sites right now.
LOLOL look at this!!!
BEFORE

package chatter;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextArea;
import javax.swing.JScrollPane;

import java.awt.Color;

import java.awt.event.KeyListener;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

import java.lang.Math;

public class ChatBot extends JFrame implements KeyListener{
	private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
	
	JPanel p=new JPanel();
	JTextArea dialog=new JTextArea(20,50);
	JTextArea input=new JTextArea(1,50);
	JScrollPane scroll=new JScrollPane(
		dialog,
		JScrollPane.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED,
		JScrollPane.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER
	);
	
	String[][] chatBot = {
	//Standard Greetings
		{"hi","hello","hola","hilo","hiya","bonjour","hey","ola","howdy","hellur","computer","chatbot","computer"},
		{"Hi","Hello","Hello Human","howdy partner","hi sir/ma'am","Bonjour","hey"},
	//Question Greetings
		{"How are you","How is it going","How are you doing","how r you","how r u","how are u","How is it going?","how are you","what's up?","are you okay?","how are you doing stewart?","how are you doing computer?","talk to me","how are you chatbot","h r u","hbu","waz up","how are you broski","how are you doing today?","how are do you doing computer"},
		{"good","doing well","I'm doing great at the moment","I'm doing great","Great","Wonderful at the moment","Just a normal chatbot day :/","I'm okay","Doing swell."},
	//Default
		{"(Sorry Stewart is unavailable at this time)","Shut up","Stop talking","Your not making sense!","(SORRY I ONLY UNDERSTAND ENGLISH)","Sorry human I do not understand","(I cannot compute that. Please contact the programmer for help)", "I do not understand you","Cannot compute that","wow your to smart for my brain","I didn't get that.","Sorry I only understand certain things","Please make me understand you","please change your wording so I can understand you","Sorry I didn't compute that string","Sorry Error Occurred Please Try Again Later"}
	};
	
	public static void main(String[] args){
		new ChatBot();
	}
	
	
	
	public ChatBot(){
		super("Chat Bot");
		setSize(600,400);
		setResizable(false);
		setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		
		dialog.setEditable(false);
		input.addKeyListener(this);
	
		p.add(scroll);
		p.add(input);
		p.setBackground((Color.green));
		add(p);
		
		setVisible(true);
	}
	
	public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e){
		if(e.getKeyCode()==KeyEvent.VK_ENTER){
			input.setEditable(false);
			//-----grab quote-----------
			String quote=input.getText();
			input.setText("");
			addText("-->You:\t"+quote);
			quote.trim();
			while(
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='!' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='@' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='#' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='$' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='%' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='^' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='&' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='*' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='(' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='_' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='-' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='+' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='=' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='`' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='~' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='?'
			){
				quote=quote.substring(0,quote.length()-1);
			}
			quote.trim();
			byte response=0;
			/*
			0:we're searching through chatBot[][] for matches
			1:we didn't find anything
			2:we did find something
			*/
			//-----check for matches----
			int j=0;//which group we're checking
			while(response==0){
				if(inArray(quote.toLowerCase(),chatBot[j*2])){
					response=2;
					int r=(int)Math.floor(Math.random()*chatBot[(j*2)+1].length);
					addText("\n-->Stewart\t"+chatBot[(j*2)+1][r]);
				}
				
				j++;
				if(j*2==chatBot.length-1 && response==0){
					response=1;
				}
			}
			
			//-----default--------------
			if(response==1){
				int r=(int)Math.floor(Math.random()*chatBot[chatBot.length-1].length);
				addText("\n-->Stewart\t"+chatBot[chatBot.length-1][r]);
			}
			addText("\n");
			}
	}
			
		
	
	
	public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e){
		if(e.getKeyCode()==KeyEvent.VK_ENTER){
			input.setEditable(true);
		}
	}
	
	public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e){}
	
	public void addText(String str){
		dialog.setText(dialog.getText()+str);
	}
	
	public boolean inArray(String in,String[] str){
		boolean match=false;
		for(int i=0;i<str.length;i++){
			if(str[i].equals(in)){
				match=true;
			}
		}
		return match;
	}
}

AFTER

package chatter;

import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JScrollPane;
import javax.swing.JTextArea;

public class ChatBot implements KeyListener {
	private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;

	JPanel p = new JPanel();
	JTextArea dialog = new JTextArea(20, 50);
	JTextArea input = new JTextArea(1, 50);
	JScrollPane scroll = new JScrollPane(dialog,
			JScrollPane.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED,
			JScrollPane.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER);

	String[][] chatBot = {
			// Standard Greetings
			{ "hi", "hello", "hola", "hilo", "hiya", "bonjour", "hey", "ola",
					"howdy", "hellur", "computer", "chatbot", "computer" },
			{ "Hi", "Hello", "Hello Human", "howdy partner", "hi sir/ma'am",
					"Bonjour", "hey" },
			// Question Greetings
			{ "How are you", "How is it going", "How are you doing",
					"how r you", "how r u", "how are u", "How is it going?",
					"how are you", "what's up?", "are you okay?",
					"how are you doing stewart?",
					"how are you doing computer?", "talk to me",
					"how are you chatbot", "h r u", "hbu", "waz up",
					"how are you broski", "how are you doing today?",
					"how are do you doing computer" },
			{ "good", "doing well", "I'm doing great at the moment",
					"I'm doing great", "Great", "Wonderful at the moment",
					"Just a normal chatbot day :/", "I'm okay", "Doing swell." },
			// Default
			{
					"(Sorry Stewart is unavailable at this time)",
					"Shut up",
					"Stop talking",
					"Your not making sense!",
					"(SORRY I ONLY UNDERSTAND ENGLISH)",
					"Sorry human I do not understand",
					"(I cannot compute that. Please contact the programmer for help)",
					"I do not understand you", "Cannot compute that",
					"wow your to smart for my brain", "I didn't get that.",
					"Sorry I only understand certain things",
					"Please make me understand you",
					"please change your wording so I can understand you",
					"Sorry I didn't compute that string",
					"Sorry Error Occurred Please Try Again Later" } };

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		new ChatBot();
	}

	public ChatBot() {
		super("Chat Bot");
		setSize(600, 400);
		setResizable(false);
		setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

		dialog.setEditable(false);
		input.addKeyListener(this);

		p.add(scroll);
		p.add(input);
		p.setBackground((Color.green));
		add(p);

		setVisible(true);
	}

	public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
		if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ENTER) {
			input.setEditable(false);
			// -----grab quote-----------
			String quote = input.getText();
			input.setText("");
			addText("-->You:\t" + quote);
			quote.trim();
			while (quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '!'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '@'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '#'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '$'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '%'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '^'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '&'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '*'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '('
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '_'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '-'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '+'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '='
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '`'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '~'
					|| quote.charAt(quote.length() - 1) == '?') {
				quote = quote.substring(0, quote.length() - 1);
			}
			quote.trim();
			byte response = 0;
			/*
			 * 0:we're searching through chatBot[][] for matches 1:we didn't
			 * find anything 2:we did find something
			 */
			// -----check for matches----
			int j = 0;// which group we're checking
			while (response == 0) {
				if (inArray(quote.toLowerCase(), chatBot[j * 2])) {
					response = 2;
					int r = (int) Math.floor(Math.random()
							* chatBot[(j * 2) + 1].length);
					addText("\n-->Stewart\t" + chatBot[(j * 2) + 1][r]);
				}

				j++;
				if (j * 2 == chatBot.length - 1 && response == 0) {
					response = 1;
				}
			}

			// -----default--------------
			if (response == 1) {
				int r = (int) Math.floor(Math.random()
						* chatBot[chatBot.length - 1].length);
				addText("\n-->Stewart\t" + chatBot[chatBot.length - 1][r]);
			}
			addText("\n");
		}
	}

	public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {
		if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ENTER) {
			input.setEditable(true);
		}
	}

	public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e) {
	}

	public void addText(String str) {
		dialog.setText(dialog.getText() + str);
	}

	public boolean inArray(String in, String[] str) {
		boolean match = false;
		for (int i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
			if (str[i].equals(in)) {
				match = true;
			}
		}
		return match;
	}
}

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[ul][li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10442665/extending-a-jframe (why extending a JFrame is not a good idea generally)[/li]
[li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14694987/why-declare-variables-private-in-a-class (lack of access modifiers)[/li]
[li]http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/codeconv-138413.html (you have a lot of arbitrary newlines and you don’t make use of whitespace consistently)[/li]
[li]http://stackoverflow.com/questions/94361/when-do-you-use-javas-override-annotation-and-why (this is more for Java 6 when it comes to overloading interface methods, but it’s still good practice)[/li]
[li]http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/201175/should-i-use-parentheses-in-logical-statements-even-where-not-necessary (your if statements sometimes use a lot of operators and the operator precedence may not be clear to other prorammers)[/li]
[li]You have a ton of statements like ‘quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)’ consecutively. Why execute this dozens of times (worst case) when you could just save it to a local variable and check that? You might think the compilers will optimize this, but it’s never guaranteed (and probably unlikely in Java).[/li]
[li]I would recommend you to use more single line comments here and there to explain what is going on.[/li]
[li]It’s not exactly a ‘best practice,’ but I personally don’t like seeing member variables initialized outside of constructors, since it makes it less clear to a programmer coming into your code what is going on (typically you go to the constructor to see what’s being built).[/li][/ul]

Just a few points I’ve noticed. There are likely other things, but these are good places to start (especially with your formatting).

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:2, topic:537362”]You don’t need to make a JPanel instance instead you can do getContentPane() because you don’t need a new pane in what you’re doing.

You should really be using a layout manager, you should be specifying access modifiers (public, private, protected). I see nobody uses ‘do while’ loops anymore lol.

As for the actual code :rolleyes: you should look at Java docs next time.

I’d work more on your formatting and naming.

You can try loading the responses from an external file.[/quote]
I guess i need to learn more about double dimensional arrays and formatting.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You don’t need to make a JPanel instance instead you can do getContentPane() because you don’t need a new pane in what you’re doing.

You should really be using a layout manager, you should be specifying access modifiers (public, private, protected). I see nobody uses ‘do while’ loops anymore lol.

As for the actual code :rolleyes: you should look at Java docs next time.
I’d work more on your formatting and naming.

You can try loading the responses from an external file.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?

item.title: How can I improve this code?
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JTextArea;
import javax.swing.JScrollPane;

import java.awt.Color;

import java.awt.event.KeyListener;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

import java.lang.Math;

public class ChatBot extends JFrame implements KeyListener{

	JPanel p=new JPanel();
	JTextArea dialog=new JTextArea(20,50);
	JTextArea input=new JTextArea(1,50);
	JScrollPane scroll=new JScrollPane(
		dialog,
		JScrollPane.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR_AS_NEEDED,
		JScrollPane.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR_NEVER
	);
	
	String[][] chatBot = {
	//Standard Greetings
		{"hi","hello","hola","hilo","hiya","bonjour","hey","ola","howdy","hellur","computer","chatbot","computer","","","","","","","",},
		{"Hi","Hello","Hello Human","howdy partner","hi sir/ma'am","Bonjour","hey"},
	//Question Greetings
		{"How are you","How is it going","How are you doing","how r you","how r u","how are u","How is it going?","how are you","what's up?","are you okay?","how are you doing stewart?","how are you doing computer?"},
		{"good","doing well","I'm doing great at the moment"},
	//Default
		{"(Sorry Stewart is unavailable at this time)","Shut up","Stop talking","Your not making sense!","(SORRY I ONLY UNDERSTAND ENGLISH)","Sorry human I do not understand","(I cannot compute that. Please contact the programmer for help)", "I do not understand you"},
	};
	
	public static void main(String[] args){
		new ChatBot();
	}
	
	
	
	public ChatBot(){
		super("Chat Bot");
		setSize(600,400);
		setResizable(false);
		setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		
		dialog.setEditable(false);
		input.addKeyListener(this);
	
		p.add(scroll);
		p.add(input);
		p.setBackground((Color.green));
		add(p);
		
		setVisible(true);
	}
	
	public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e){
		if(e.getKeyCode()==KeyEvent.VK_ENTER){
			input.setEditable(false);
			//-----grab quote-----------
			String quote=input.getText();
			input.setText("");
			addText("-->You:\t"+quote);
			quote.trim();
			while(
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='!' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='@' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='#' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='$' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='%' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='^' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='&' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='*' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='(' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='_' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='-' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='+' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='=' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='`' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='~' ||
				quote.charAt(quote.length()-1)=='?'
			){
				quote=quote.substring(0,quote.length()-1);
			}
			quote.trim();
			byte response=0;
			/*
			0:we're searching through chatBot[][] for matches
			1:we didn't find anything
			2:we did find something
			*/
			//-----check for matches----
			int j=0;//which group we're checking
			while(response==0){
				if(inArray(quote.toLowerCase(),chatBot[j*2])){
					response=2;
					int r=(int)Math.floor(Math.random()*chatBot[(j*2)+1].length);
					addText("\n-->Stewart\t"+chatBot[(j*2)+1][r]);
				}
				
				j++;
				if(j*2==chatBot.length-1 && response==0){
					response=1;
				}
			}
			
			//-----default--------------
			if(response==1){
				int r=(int)Math.floor(Math.random()*chatBot[chatBot.length-1].length);
				addText("\n-->Stewart\t"+chatBot[chatBot.length-1][r]);
			}
			addText("\n");
			}
	}
			
		
	
	
	public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e){
		if(e.getKeyCode()==KeyEvent.VK_ENTER){
			input.setEditable(true);
		}
	}
	
	public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e){}
	
	public void addText(String str){
		dialog.setText(dialog.getText()+str);
	}
	
	public boolean inArray(String in,String[] str){
		boolean match=false;
		for(int i=0;i<str.length;i++){
			if(str[i].equals(in)){
				match=true;
			}
		}
		return match;
	}
}

I know that If i actually try to code the arrays fully it will take a long time. Do you guys have any ideas for this?

Read full topic
item.source: How can I improve this code?
